data.title: Liberty Hall Historic Site (Frankfort)
data.meta_description: Liberty Hall Historic Site is a museum in Frankfort. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
Liberty Hall, located at 218 Wilkinson Street in Frankfort, Kentucky, is a historic house museum. It was constructed between 1796 and 1800 by the American statesman John Brown. This site is recognized for its association with Brown and its fine Federal-style architecture.

Location of Liberty Hall

Liberty Hall is situated west of downtown Frankfort, at the southwest corner of Wilkinson and West Main Streets. It offers a scenic view overlooking the Kentucky River, adding to the charm of the historic site.

Visiting Liberty Hall Today

Today, Liberty Hall and the adjacent Orlando Brown House function as a historic house museum and site. Tours of Liberty Hall are available from Monday to Saturday at 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 p.m., from mid-March to mid-November. This offers visitors a chance to explore and learn about the rich history of the site.
